Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • Map

  • public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
    Singleton Class used to create a Map for the player to play on.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static Map instance 
      private char[][] map 
      private boolean[][] revealed 

    • Constructor Summary

      Private Constructor Accessible only through getInstance().

    • Constructor Detail

      • Map

        private Map()
        Private Constructor Accessible only through getInstance(). Only one instance of this class may exist.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Map getInstance()
        Retrieves the Map. If instance does not exist, create it.
        Returns:
        Map Instance

      • loadMap

        public void loadMap(int mapNum)
        Loads the map into memory based on the given integer. Assumes format of File name as "AreaN.txt" where N is area number. If FileNotFoundException is thrown, nothing happens. Supports any sized map.
        Parameters:
        mapNum - Represents map text file number, i.e. 1 means file "Area1.txt"

      • getCharAtLoc

        public char getCharAtLoc(java.awt.Point p)
        Finds the character at the location given. Returns '\0' should there be an invalid point given.
        Returns:
        Character representing the location. '\0' if an invalid point.

      • mapToString

        public java.lang.String mapToString(java.awt.Point p)
        Translates the map into a String. The returned String will show x in unrevealed spots. Provided location will be marked as * for the trainer.
        Parameters:
        p - Location of the Trainer.

      • findStart

        public java.awt.Point findStart()
        Returns the location of the start point. If a start point cannot be found, null is returned. If a start is found, it is revealed and returned.
        Returns:
        Point Object that represents the location. Returns null if not found.

      • reveal

        public void reveal(java.awt.Point p)
        Reveals a location on the map. If the map location is invalid, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        p - Point to reveal.

      • removeCharAtLoc

        public void removeCharAtLoc(java.awt.Point p)
        Removes a character at the given location. If the map location is invalid, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        p - Point to set to 'n' (Nothing).
